meanings.definition: A three-wheeled vehicle, typically propelled by pedaling.
meanings.sent1: My little brother loves riding his trike around the park.
meanings.sent2: The children raced their trikes down the street.
meanings.sent3: The trike wobbled as the toddler tried to steer it straight.
meanings.sent4: Her trike was a symbol of independence and freedom.
meanings.sent5: The shiny red trike gleamed in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To ride or operate a trike.
meanings.sent1: I learned how to trike when I was five years old.
meanings.sent2: She trikes to work every morning for exercise.
meanings.sent3: He trikes so fast that he leaves everyone behind.
meanings.sent4: Triking through the countryside feels like flying on wheels.
meanings.sent5: Triking along the beach at sunset is so peaceful.

meanings.definition: A shortened form of the word tricycle.
meanings.sent1: The kids asked for a trike for their birthday.
meanings.sent2: She bought a new trike for her nephew as a gift.
meanings.sent3: The trike was too small for the older kids to ride comfortably.
meanings.sent4: The word 'trike' is a fun way to say tricycle.
meanings.sent5: The bright yellow trike stood out among the other bikes.
